content.description:
An long easy route up the center of the slab with abundant large holds and huge stances. Bolts where you want them, a good beginner lead. This route is a fun solo, the slab is very low angle and the rock is solid. Simply take the path of least resistance. Appropriate to climb in sticky rubber approach shoes if you have them. Exposed scramble to set up a TR, probably easier to just lead it.

Note:

pitch is a full 35 meters, use a 70 meter rope or be prepared to downclimb easy terrain at the bottom.

Tie a knot in the end of your rope!
content.location: Route goes up left of center on Sunrise Slab, to the right of Emerald Arete. Walk off the top.

content.description: This climb follows a series of small positive edges up vertical terrain at the start, with a crux near the third bolt. The difficulty eases up at the top, route shares an anchor with Hot Flash.
content.location: Located on the short steep east face of Sunrise Slab, this is the leftmost route which begins after scrambling up a ramp for several feet.

content.description: Three bolts of steep hard climbing up overhanging flakes bring you to a much appreciated rest. Stand up tall and clip a bolt at the lip of the roof before committing to a couple of thuggy moves to surmount the roof and corner.
content.location: The furthest left line which ascends steep flakes at the start.

content.description:
This short route has a strange off-balance crux after the second bolt, then eases up somewhat but stays engaging to the anchor. Difficult to onsight, possible to set up a TR by first leading Spark of Desire.

The start requires using a questionable dinner-plate sized block; it is probably best for the belayer to not stand directly beneath it.
content.location: Located on the short steep east face of Sunrise Slab, this is the rightmost route.

content.description: A bouldery start for the first two bolts leads to a decent rest before pulling the obvious roof. A few steep moves on large jugs leads to progressively easier climbing until you reach the anchors. The start can be bypassed by traversing into the right, this drops the grade to 10b.
content.location: Start below a modest roof near orange rock.

content.description:
This route follows intermittent weaknesses up the left side of Sunrise Slab, beginning with a fairly obvious small corner. Very easy climbing with just enough gear placements, no fixed anchor.

While possible to lead, this route is probably more enjoyable as a solo as gear placements are somewhat broadly spaced and the climbing is quite easy.
content.protection:
Gear, single rack small to 3" (possibly double 0.75-1" for anchor)

Note: nothing bigger than 1" for lead, gear 0.75"-3" for anchor
content.location:
Approach from a gully to the north of the route (towards the parking area). Not the gully immediately adjacent to the slab, but the next one over.

Route starts on the far left side of Sunrise Slab, walk off the top.
